metadata.title: CVE-2014-3200 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 38.0.2125.101allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impactvia unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-browser-l10n - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-chromedriver - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu1.1103').
